citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
* There is an accumulation of white bird waste, brown dirt and debris on the tin wall and 2 X 4 wood horizontal
frame along the side of an enclosure housing two adult dogs. This wood board was off the ground and allows for the bird
waste dirt and debris to fall into the enclosure. This can attract birds and other pests and increasing the disease potential.
For the prevention of diseases and attraction of birds and other pests, all surfaces for enclosures and along and over
enclosures must be free of waste, dirt and debris.
To be corrected by, 20-May-2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
* An end enclosure, housing two adult dogs, has an accumulation of bird waste on the wood framing along the side of the
enclosure. This indicates a pest program is not being maintained, therefore increasing contamination by pests or birds
and potentially affecting the well-being of the animals.
An effective program for the control of insects, birds, pests must be established and maintained, so to protect the health
and well-being of the dogs and reducing contamination by pests.
To be corrected by, 05-May-2023.

* The adult dogs were not vaccinated for distemper and there is no record of the vaccination. This can increase the
disease potential for the 29 dogs. The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) does not list the sampling or testing of parasites
and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia and heartworm) scheduled by the A.V. This indicates the
sampling size and frequency of testing is not happening and can increase the parasite, pest and disease potential for the
29 adult dogs.
For the prevention, testing and treatment of diseases, all dogs must receive required vaccinations and sampling of testing
for parasites and other pest scheduled in accordance with the A.V.
To be corrected by, 25-May-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
*  There is an accumulation of white bird waste, brown dirt and debris on the tin wall and 2 X 4 wood horizontal 
frame along the side of an enclosure housing two adult dogs. This wood board was off the ground and allows for the bird 
waste dirt and debris to fall into the enclosure.  This can attract birds and other pests and increasing the disease potential.  
 
For the prevention of diseases and attraction of birds and other pests, all surfaces for enclosures and along and over 
enclosures must be free of waste, dirt and debris.  
 
To be corrected by, 20-May-2023. 
3.11(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
* An end enclosure, housing two adult dogs, has an accumulation of bird waste on the wood framing along the side of the 
enclosure.  This indicates a pest program is not being maintained, therefore increasing contamination by pests or birds 
and potentially affecting the well-being of the animals. 
 
An effective program for the control of insects, birds, pests must be established and maintained, so to protect the health

and well-being of the dogs and reducing contamination by pests.  
 
To be corrected by, 05-May-2023. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
*   The adult dogs were not vaccinated for distemper and there is no record of the vaccination.  This can increase the 
disease potential for the 29 dogs.  The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) does not list the sampling or testing of parasites 
and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia and heartworm) scheduled by the A.V.  This indicates the 
sampling size and frequency of testing is not happening and can increase the parasite, pest and disease potential for the 
29 adult dogs. 
 
For the prevention, testing and treatment of diseases, all dogs must receive required vaccinations and sampling of testing 
for parasites and other pest scheduled in accordance with the A.V. 
 
To be corrected by, 25-May-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
